attributes.action: The People's Mandate. Electorate vote on the agenda of next parliament.
attributes.background: Give the electorate a preliminary vote in the year before each General Election, that will allow them to choose the agenda of the next parliament & provide the political parties with a 'people's mandate' by which they design their manifestos to serve. For too long the word 'Mandate' has been abused.
attributes.additional_details: This 'Preliminary Vote' could be in the form of a list of government departments or pressing issues that the country faces. The electorate would vote on their top 3 priorities and this would be collated to provide the future government with a democratic mandate from which to form their manifestos. To date, the people get what they are given. With a preliminary vote on issues of importance the people get to be more involved in driving the political policy of the next parliament.

attributes.action: Stop pharmacies from throwing away unused drugs returned when no longer required
attributes.background: When a patient has no further use for prescribed drugs, we are encouraged to return them to a pharmacy. However, current practice is to destroy the drugs, even when it can easily be confirmed whether or not the drugs have already been opened. This wasteful practice should end, saving the NHS money.

attributes.action: Bring forward the 2020 London Mayoral Elections to 2019.
attributes.background: The 2020 London mayoral elections should be brought forward from 2020 to 2019 in order to de-conflict with a possible general election also due 2020.
attributes.additional_details:
The current London assembly is running with the idea that the election should be delayed until 2021 because of the chance of a general election in the same year (2020). This will give the current mayor an extra 12 months in power without being re-elected.

Londoners should be given the opportunity to select a new mayor sooner rather than later. The people of London must be given the chance to rid themselves of the massive increase in crime associated with the current mayor.

attributes.action: Cut Overseas Aid budget by 50% & give £7bn saved to NHS, rather than more taxes.
attributes.background: UK commits to UN target that each country gives 0.7% of GNI (Gross National Income) for Overseas Aid. Only 6 (inc UK) of the 28 participants achieve target - average for all is 0.30% - (OECD 2015). UK pays c10% of total - ie £14bn of £140bn. As NHS is in need, £7bn could save it. Charity at home!
attributes.additional_details:
Source 2015 OECD.

The other 5 countries hitting the target are: Netherlands, Denmark, Luxembourg, Norway and Sweden - all relatively small economies, with positive attitudes to aid.  

The other members of the G8 seem to have an alternative attitude: USA 0.17%, Japan 0.22%, Russia 0%, Canada 0.28%, Italy 0.21%, Germany 0.52%, France 0.37%.

If we went to half of what we currently pay, we'd still be achieving 0.35%; still more than all other G8 members apart from Germany and, marginally, France.

attributes.action: Negotiate a deal to keep the UK in the Digital Single Market
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to specifically negotiate the UKs future relationship to the Digital Single Market in the final Brexit deal.  Ignoring the digital economy would put the UK’s future prosperity and thousands of jobs unnecessarily at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
The digital economy is borderless yet depends on consumer trust and business confidence. Leaving the Digital Single Market will tax that confidence in more ways than one. We ask the HM Government to start being responsible for publicly addressing:
(1) future relations to EU agencies such as ENISA and EDPB 
(2) participation in EU funded research 
(3) regulatory alignment to EU rules for telecoms (incl. free roaming), data protection, consumer rights, audio visual media services, and copyright.

attributes.action: Insist the Government give a 50% discount for Council Tax single occupants
attributes.background: At the moment single occupants get a 25% reduction in their Council Tax which is most unfair. In houses with more than one person there are more like to be dual or more incomes, so there the reduction should be 50% to single occupant earners or pensioners as they are pay 25% more on one income.

attributes.action: Change the law to make the sex offenders register public
attributes.background: Every few months we hear of another sex offender who’s been living in our area beside our kids and schools, our children are not safe to walk to school or play with friends because they keep them protected and not the people at real risk

attributes.action: There should be centrally funded, free, total and complete care for the elderly
attributes.background: I want to free the elderly from the huge burden of trying to fund their own care at the end of their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to free the local authority from the burden of trying to fund care of the elderly when they do not have the money
I want to free the families from the burden of having to make up any shortfall in funding in order to give their loved ones the complete care they need
I want to see some meaningful return for the taxes we have paid throughout our working lives
Finally, it is the mark of a civilised nation that the state safeguards and has a duty of care towards the elderly: the most vulnerable In our society

attributes.action: Car Tax to start from the day you Tax your car and end the day you sell.
attributes.background: If someone buys a car from me mid month and they part exchange their old car they are losing out twice. This is because the new car tax is back dated to the beginning of the month, and the old car can only claim every complete month remaining!

attributes.action: Mandatory for all alcoholic beverages to display nutritional information
attributes.background: I suffer with type 1 diabetes but want to lead a normal life. Identifying the total carbohydrate content of a beer from various internet searches is difficult and unreliable. Furthmore we have a nation of growing waistbands, shouldn't the calorific content of alcohol be visible to inform consumers?

attributes.action: Change the way the dangerous dogs act is administered
attributes.background: Instead of dogs being unfairly imprisoned based on a non confirmed act of aggression, have the authorities act upon this in a timely manner to prevent stress to the animal. This stress is unjustified and an act of cruelty towards animals where the animal where there is evidence to the contrary.
attributes.additional_details: I write this based on a personal experience where a family dog has been in custody of an animal shelter based on false allegations. There is evidence to show the allegations are false yet the authorities are not acting upon this in a timely manner. The stress this causes to an animal is astronomical and should be deemed as cruelty which is unlawful. I call for the government to place a time frame on when cases are heard in court or for legislation to be brought forward to review evidence sooner.

attributes.action: Abolish workplace parking charges for NHS staff
attributes.background: These people dedicate their lives to helping the sick and vulnerable and are often poorly paid . It seems extremely unfair that they should be charged for attending work.

attributes.action: Urge Iceland to stop killing endangered whales
attributes.background: They have killed endangered Fin and Blue whales. They must stop.

attributes.action: Vaccinate all children against Chickenpox
attributes.background: The last four days I have watched my two daughters scream in agony as their Chickenpox became itchy and painful. People presuppose Chickenpox is a mild infection but that is not always the case. It is about time that we eliminated this illness and added it to the childhood immunisation schedule.
attributes.additional_details:
It is assumed that Chickenpox is a mild virus that does not require vaccination. However, this is not always the case and secondary infection can result which can lead to hospital admission and even fatality. The NHS website outlines this in more clinical detail. Another important factor is the sheer anguish and suffering of those who catch it. Chickepox is very itchy and painful and most children find it extremely distressing. When a vaccine is available, would we not choose to eliminate this suffering?
In other countries such as the US and Australia, a vaccine is offered as part of the childhood immunisation schedule. Let us not let cost stop us eliminating this horrible illness once and for all.

attributes.action: Cut National Citizens Service funding and apply funds to schools and the NHS
attributes.background: In 2017 NCS recieved £180.5 million from the government and has proceeded to spend it on extravagant advertisements instead of the actual service. This money could be better used by schools which constantly face budget cuts and the NHS which is in desperate need of more funding.

attributes.action: Classify professional avoidable negligence as a criminal act
attributes.background: Of course mistakes happen, but too many are avoidable, and are classified as 'civil'. Many are not subject to criminal investigation, when sometimes this should be the case. 'Individuals' should also be held accountable. This would be a deterrent and lower the authority compensation liability.
attributes.additional_details: Professionals with a duty of care be it medical, social care, community or residential care that cause avoidable physical or mental harm, abuse, neglect or death through direct involvement and incorrect decision making, should be fully investigated through the justice system and the crown prosecution service and charged with criminal neglect. The logic is that it would encourage professionals to think twice and provide a strong deterrent when making hasty, rash and bias life changing decisions.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of disposable BBQs in the UK
attributes.background:
Disposable BBQs are bad for the environment in terms of use & disposal

Are made using unsustainable materials from tropical forests in South Africa and South America
Can't be recycled
Burn the grass & typically result it scattered litter
Local residents are unable to open windows
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.hackneycitizen.co.uk/2018/03/21/hackney-council-cracks-down-bbqs-london-fields/

http://news.hackney.gov.uk/london-fields-disposable-barbecue-ban

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/3666716/Is-it-worth-it-Disposable-barbecues.html

attributes.action: Urge the Indian Government to investigate and prevent Sterlite pollution
attributes.background: British company Vedanta Sterlite Copper begun construction of a new 4 million tonne/year smelter, almost doubling capacity. The existing smelter is believed to have continuously polluted the water and air since 1996, causing respiratory, dermal infections and other illness, particularly in children.
attributes.additional_details:
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/10-killed-as-cops-fire-on-anti-sterlite-protesters-in-tuticorin/articleshow/64279479.cms 
The Env Impact Assessment is believed to be a sham. Coastal regulations forbidding the location of industrial plant within 25km of the Gulf of Mannar biosphere reserve were ignored. Reports of illegal waste dumps and port data reveal the use of highly contaminated copper concentrates and indicate that waste has been disposed of in the Gulf of Mannar.

attributes.action: Help stop the growing violence and murders of Christians in Nigeria
attributes.background: It is estimated that over 16,000 Christians have been killed in Nigeria since 2015. No group has been brought to justice and the scale of these atrocities keeps rising. We need the UK Government to add pressure on the Nigerian govt. to put a stop to these killings before it escalates to war.
attributes.additional_details:
These are links from local news papers and social media 
https://www.vanguardngr.com/2017/06/will-protect-nigerias-northern-christians/
https://www.persecution.org/2018/02/13/report-claims-16000-christians-killed-nigeria-since-2015/
https://www.spectator.co.uk/2017/02/who-will-protect-nigerias-northern-christians/

attributes.action: Create a Memorial Day for all killed working in emergency services
attributes.background: Many people in the emergency services sadly lose their lives while carrying out their duty. We should create a day to remember them, separate from Remembrance Sunday and other memorial days.

attributes.action: Make Single File riding compulsory for cyclists.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, respectfully call on the Transport Minister to implement Compulsory Single File for all cyclists who ride in groups,  regardless of whether a bike lane exists or not..
attributes.additional_details:
We are tired of seeing cyclists continue to ride two or more abreast, spilling into traffic and impeding traffic flow.

We are tired of the safety hazards such cyclists present. We believe no other safety initiative will deliver better results than compelling cyclists to ride Single File.  indeed, every text book on the subject of Risk Management says that “isolating a hazard” is a superior solution to changing the way people operate. A bike lane is an example of “Isolating the Hazard”.

attributes.action: Repeal the 1997 handgun amendment act & legalise conceal-carry.
attributes.background: The signatories of this petition want to see handguns, rifles & shotguns treated like any other dangerous tool; available to law-abiding citizens in the same way cars are; with licensing & training to all who desire them for self-defence. The time has come.

attributes.action: Encourage schools to expell students who are bullying others.
attributes.background: All across the world, students are bullied in school. However, this is increasing dramatically. Head teachers should be encouraged to expel students who are bullying other students, as the victims often do not feel safe while the bullies are around.
attributes.additional_details: Young people/students have enough school related stress to deal with such as exams and coursework. Being bullied can affect their grades, their self esteem and in a lot of cases, their lives. Schools should be encouraged to expel individuals who bully others, out of respect for the victims. Many young people do not feel safe in school due to bullying, and this must stop altogether.

attributes.action: ban homework
attributes.background:
i don't like homework, students don't like homework, teachers don't like homework, so why is homework a thing? we don't need it, so lets get rid of it!
it prevents social building of students, and increases the workload heavily on teachers. homework is bad for everyone, the recipient, and producer.
attributes.additional_details: i hate homework, so let's get rid of it

attributes.action: Make health workers exempt from parking tickets when delivering a public service
attributes.background: Allow domiciliary carers, emergency services, District nurses and doctors to park on single or double yellow lines when carrying out a health service for the public in their own homes.
attributes.additional_details: Care workers,District nurse,emergency services&doctors find it difficult to park when delivering a care service.if they display a notice,when parked on yellow lines, explaining they're there for a reason,they should be exempt from parking tickets within a certain time frame.The health services are under massive constraints&strains&are extremely limited to time,Parking issues need to be addressed. Councils pay for care to be delivered but penalise those very people when parking is unavailable.

attributes.action: Ban TV alcohol advertising completely.
attributes.background:
There are far too many alcohol adverts on TV. Pretty much all of them glamourise alcohol use, making it seem like you'll have a more adventurous life by drinking.

Let's save our people, help alcoholics quit and reduce binge drinking, by banning alcohol advertising on TV completely!
attributes.additional_details:
We all know how much damage alcohol causes. Many thousands of people are hospitalised yearly due to the use (or OVER use) of alcohol.

It is a scourge on our young people, in whom we are now seeing record levels of binge drinking amongst teenagers and people in their early 20s. 

The Beer federation at one point put out a literal "Beer goes with everything" advert. Why is this OK?

NO MORE ENCOURAGEMENT OF DRINKING BY GLAMOURISING IT IN OUR TV ADVERTISING!

attributes.action: No to automatic opt in for organ donation
attributes.background: UK resident will be automatically opted in for organ donation and will have the choice to opt out after the Bill is passed.  This law should not be passed because it is our body and it is our human right to opt in ourselves if we want to.
attributes.additional_details: Our body is not the property of the government to give this consent on our behalf. It is a  violation of our human rights. People are aware of organ donation and can choose to opt in if they wish to opt in. People may not be able to opt out before their death as death can be sudden. People may not be aware of this law so it will be unethical to opt them in as they wouldn't know they have to opt out. We refuse this law should be passed where peoole are automatically registered to organ donation.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for teachers to search students' phones without consent.
attributes.background: Ever since 2011 it has been legal for teachers to search through students’ phones without the consent of the student. Students are human as well, and just because we are on school grounds does not mean we should lose our rights - unconsented searches are a complete violation of our rights to privacy
attributes.additional_details: Teachers can search through student’s phones with little more information than someone saying something to the teacher. This is completely ridiculous and happened recently at a school - where boys were forced to hand over their phones for the teacher to go through, despite the fact that what the teacher was insinuating had not happened and they had no more evidence to go through the phone other than a meaningless accusation. This is a violation of our privacy - and should not be allowed.

attributes.action: "Warning" labels on dog flea shampoos containing Pyrethrum as toxic to cats.
attributes.background: I washed my cat with dog flea shampoo. There was no warning label on the product. In small writing amongst other text it stated it should never be used on cats. Unfortunately, my beloved companion died 2 days later. This type of poisoning is not uncommon.
attributes.additional_details: The product I used was a standard dog flea shampoo purchased over the counter for my dog weeks beforehand, but I didn't think it would be harmful to my cat.  Clear, informed "Warning" labels should be on the front of such products indicating they are toxic to cats. This will hopefully prevent other cats from being harmed or dying as a result of the chemical Pyrethrum which they can't metabolise, yet dogs can.

attributes.action: No foreign aid to Pakistan for supporting terrorism.
attributes.background: Pakistan soil has become a training camp for terrorists. The government of Pakistan have been supporting terrorists; UK foreign aid therefore goes to terrorists. Government must immediately stop all foreign aid to Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details: On one hand, they show that they have taken action to tackle terrorism; on the other hand, they support terrorism for their own gain. Granting foreign aid to Pakistan seems as if we are financially supporting the terrorists. Many terrorist-related events in Afghanistan, India and other countries are initiated in Pakistan. Recent bomb blasts in Afghanistan killed hundreds of innocent people.

attributes.action: Ban building on all greenfield sites.
attributes.background: Builders should only be allowed to build on brownfield sites including over railways, supermarkets, derelict sites. The UK needs to protect all remaining greenfield for food safety and clean air.

attributes.action: Demand President Trump pays for the extra security of his visit, and not the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is to provide upgraded security for the visit of Donald Trump. This visit is unwanted by the citizens of the UK, due to the actions of the president and the united states government under his control. We there for demand the united states pays the additional costs and not our tax payers.

attributes.action: Prohibit the sale and use of alcohol
attributes.background:
The UK Government cannot claim that cannabis deserves to be illegal while allowing the use of alcohol, which has continually been proven to cause far more damage than cannabis.

The UK remains the largest exporter of cannabis in the world while maintaining it has no medicinal value.
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol is directly responsible for an estimated cost to the NHS of £3.5 billion annually. 
Alcohol-related crime is estimated to cost between £8bn and £13bn per year.
In 2014-5, there were around 1.1 million hospital admissions related to alcohol consumption where an alcohol-related disease, injury or condition was the primary reason for admission.

This is clear evidence that alcohol is a harmful drug which can damage people’s mental and physical health, and harms individuals and communities.

attributes.action: Implement transitional employment for service leavers and veterans
attributes.background: Service leavers and veterans are currently discharged from service with no guarantee of transitional employment that would allow time for decompression of physical/mental health recovery. Service can be a long period of institutionalised pattern setting for veterans. There is a need for adjustment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/former-soldier-mp-says-veterans-12084010

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5426377/Freed-Royal-Marine-Alexander-Blackman-gets-new-job.html

Veterans make up 1 in 10 of the UK populous, we have upto 10000 in the HM prison service and 7,000 rough sleeping, about 170,000 working age veterans are unemployed or economically inactive with a veteran suicide every two weeks!

We need a significant change in support services!

attributes.action: Remove the Home Office exemption from the Data Protection Act
attributes.background: The Home Office has been given an exemption from GDPR and the data protection Act 2018. Citizens have a right to know what is being discussed with regard to their cases and an exemption puts us at risk of more scandals such as windrush.
attributes.additional_details: Citizens should not be denied the right to their data and further exclusions from society.

attributes.action: Cancel fees for children born in UK before their parents acquired settlement
attributes.background: Children born in UK whose parents were not settled at the time have to pay £1,012 to register them as British citizens is disproportionate and wrong. Assuming  parents who have three kids before acquiring  settlement or becoming a British citizens have to pay over £3,036.
attributes.additional_details:
HOME OFFICE FEES WITH EFFECT FROM 6 APRIL 2018 FOR CITIZENSHIP APPLICATIONS AND THE RIGHT OF 
ABODE:
CHILDREN
 B(OTA), B(OS) EM, MN1, S2, S3, T.
Child under 18 applying to register as a British citizen 
**An additional £80 per applicant is required to cover the ceremony fee should 
the child turn 18 during the application process. This will be required at point of 
decision.

Fees:£1012

attributes.action: Ban all non-biodegradable plastic used within the fashion industry
attributes.background: There are estimated 12.7 million tonnes of plastic ends up in the ocean every year. This waste releases toxins, absorbed by animals, subsequently entering the food chain. A ban on non-biodegradable plastic from the fashion industry could limit the micro-plastics that end up in the ocean.
attributes.additional_details:
- Greenpeace (2018). Ocean Plastic. Available at: https://www.greenpeace.org.uk/what-we-do/oceans/plastics/ (Accessed: 30 April 2018).
- Kozlowski, A., Bardecki, M. & Searcy, C., 2012. Environmental Impacts in the Fashion Industry: A Life-cycle and Stakeholder Framework. The Journal of Corporate Citizenship, (45), pp.17–36.
- Seltenrich, N., 2015. New link in the food chain? Marine plastic pollution and seafood safety. Environmental health perspectives, 123(2), pp.A34–41.

attributes.action: End any form of Monarchy in the UK and end all payments to the Royal Family.
attributes.background: Considering the financial state of the UK and with costs being cut left, right and centre is it perhaps time we cut one of the largest expenses? The Queen receives a HUGE payment from the tax payers of the United Kingdom on top of profits made from her own private lands. Both in the millions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Royal Family spend millions on travel, renovations and many luxuries. These costs don't include the hiring of security, among other things such as Royal Weddings. 
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2017/jun/27/queens-income-rises-to-82m-to-cover-cost-of-buckingham-palace-works
https://www.coventrytelegraph.net/news/coventry-news/how-much-royal-family-cost-14111218

attributes.action: Proportional charge for all Governmental Fixed Penalty Notices and Fines.
attributes.background: We, the signed, call on the government to implement the same policy that is already practiced by  governments in other european countries such as Denmark and Iceland in which Fines are charged to a proportion of the offenders income. This way punishment is same for all, as it is meant to be in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Think about it this way 2 people walking down the road both drop litter and are given a fixed penalty notice of £80. The first person comes from a household earning £200 a week and the other £200 a day. This is not a fair measure, this nearly 7x worse for the person who can afford it the least.

A proportional system means both parties receive the same impact and that impact can be kept from being up to half the weekly income of people who are potentially facing growing poverty.

attributes.action: Increase the defence budget to strengthen and build up the UK's Armed Forces.
attributes.background: The UK needs to strengthen and build up it's Armed Forces in order to be able to counter any threat to the Nation and to better its capabilities as a part of NATO.

attributes.action: Allow supply teachers to pay into the 'Teachers' Pension'.
attributes.background: Supply teachers cannot pay into the Teachers' Pension. If you are contracted for 2 hours a week you can opt-in, but as a supply teacher working 5 days a week you can't. Why? Because supply agencies don't employ us, so can't pay the employer's contribution. The ethics of agencies are another debate.
attributes.additional_details: Supply teachers used to be employed by LEAs. They were paid to scale, had pay progression and a pension. Successive governments have turned a blind eye to agencies taking this role where supply teachers are not paid to scale, have no pay progression and have no pension. A supply teacher will earn £16000 a year if they work every school day (the agencies having got £29,250 for that teacher). Some things we have to accept: the government signing our pension away, we shouldn't have to.

attributes.action: Toughen UK knife laws, raise the age to buy knives over 3 inches to 21 years old
attributes.background: Knife crime is an epidemic in the UK, surely raising the age to buy knives would shrink the culture our country has normalised. It would mean teenagers can no longer buy knives to use as weapons. Knife crime was 6x more likely to occur in 2017 than gun crime. I wonder why?
attributes.additional_details: London has a huge issue with knife and gang related crime, minimising the amount of people able to buy knives must surely impact this. Nearly 13000 recorded incidents of knife crime in Just London last year, with less knives on the street in the wrong hands surely this statistic would also plummet.

attributes.action: Introduce a law for raised minimum temperature for employees or send home.
attributes.background: Worked as Receptionist & had poor work temperatures & inadequate heating for building. I feel it's important a law is put in place to outline a realistic,acceptable minimum & maximum work environment temperature for all employees or send employees home if needs are not met. As 16C is too cold.
attributes.additional_details:
According to The workplace (Health, Safety & Welfare) regulations 1992. 

There is "no law outlining the  minimum or maximum work environment temperature. According to Health & Safety executive a "reasonable" work environment should be provided by employers. According to the approved code of practice, a workplace should be atleast 16C and 13C for an environment that requires rigorous physical effort." I feel this is too cold for most in a work environment. This should be assessed and changed.

attributes.action: Reduce the deadline date of the tampon tax from 2022 to 2019!
attributes.background: The Treasury vowed to axe the outdated tax on all sanitary products in January 2016. Currently, the Tampon Tax is set to be abolished by 2022 at the earliest. Help to put an end to the marginalisation of issues of women by demanding a zero tax rate for sanitary products.
attributes.additional_details:
Women are expected to spend £900 in tax for their periods in their lifetime. Menstruation should not be labelled as a luxury.

Together, with the abolishment of the tampon tax, we can get rid of the taboo around menstruation.

attributes.action: New drivers to have black box with continuous speeding reported to the police
attributes.background: Most new drivers today think they are invincible on the roads. All black boxes do at the moment is record excessive speeding to the car insurance companies that use them. Why are these behaviours not reported to the police and why are drivers not punished for this behaviour?
attributes.additional_details: It should be mandatory that all new drivers have a black box for their first year of driving, with all continuous excessive speeding data sent to the police. Police should deal with this behaviour the same as if they caught the driver themselves, via a driving awareness course or points. Black boxes shouldn’t be limited to just cars either, they should be on all road legal transportation. This could not only potentially save lives, but save money on insurance in the long run too.

attributes.action: Make Government spending transparent, adjust funding "increases" for inflation
attributes.background: Often funding increases are announced, which amount to a funding cut after inflation. The only transparent approach is to deflate figures for inflation to give an increase figure in "real terms".
attributes.additional_details:
Full Fact provides evidence that the Grant review for police funding amounts to a cut after inflation.
https://fullfact.org/crime/police-funding-england-and-wales/

Conservatives say Labour voted against an increase.
https://www.facebook.com/conservatives/photos/a.288165009278.146725.8807334278/10155780194029279/?type=3&theater

Labour say Conservatives voted for a real terms cut.
https://www.facebook.com/labourparty/posts/10155283147077411

attributes.action: Make councils set up payment plans for parking tickets instead of total payment
attributes.background: Make it so councils have to let people pay fines in installmemts for people who can’t afford to pay in a lump sum for parking tickets. Instead of passing it to private bailiff firms who add more costs and won’t accept an affordable payment plan until their fees have been added on.
attributes.additional_details: I had a parking ticket which I couldn’t pay in a lump sum.  The council wouldn’t let me pay in installmemts so it got passed to the bailiffs and more charges put on. Then they came and clamped my van I use for self employed work and removed it after they were told it was for my business and valued under £1350. I have a 7 year old child who I can not get to school anymore and I have no income now and have complained and appealed but still no van. I made payments but they wanted £80 a month.

attributes.action: Introduce new opportunities for medically failing applicants for the military.
attributes.background: Applicants who have applied and had their heart set on starting a military career with the correct attitude, fitness and skills who are turned away for, in some cases, minor or none apparent disabilities or injuries should be given more opportunities or choices.
attributes.additional_details: The modern military is diverse and equal such as allowing women to fight on the front lines but the the fact that you may not be allowed to serve on the front lines or for your country in any role due to a predicted adherent or minor issue has affected the majority of applying citizens. I understand that the military is required to uphold certain standards and a minimum level of fitness, qualities and skills from it's personnel depending on the various roles. However, when a potential candidate is not given the chance to prove their usefulness, or given any chance of finding their place in the military things need to changed or at the very least looked into.

attributes.action: Pressure the Cameroon government to organise a referendum in Southern Cameroons.
attributes.background: Southern Cameroon was a Trust territory of the UK with its mandate ending in 1961 where a Plebiscite was organised by the UN giving the people the option of either joining Cameroon/Nigeria to gain its independence.The present crisis in the region is a direct consequence of the failure that process
attributes.additional_details:
Britain has a key role to play in the present crisis in Southern Cameroons.On 1st October 2017 Southern Cameroons reasserted its independence from Cameroun. It now has an interim government and now recognizes itself as the Republic of Ambazonia.

The problem in Southern Cameroons is a consequence of failed decolonisation.UN resolution 1514 reaffirms the right of every people to self determination.Denial of that right or subjugation of a people to an alien power is a frequent cause of conflict.

attributes.action: We would like the livestock act 1953 to be amended to include alpaca and llama.
attributes.background: Our Alpaca boys were attacked by two lurchers, leaving them traumatised & having to re-home. No prosecution was possible as  the dogs do not fall under the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991, and llamas and alpacas are not protected by the Dogs (Protection of Livestock) Act 1953.
attributes.additional_details: We think this act should be amended to protect these animals.
